text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello i am priyasha a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
bangalore today i am going to show you
how users can use amazon cloudfront to
serve the static website hosted on s3
let's get started
in this video i am going to show three
ways to serve a static website hosted on
amazon's simple storage service
you can deploy a cloudfront distribution
using one of this configurations based
on your use case
the first way is using rest api endpoint
as the origin with access restricted by
an oai
for this login to your s3 console
create a bucket and then upload the
website files
for this video i have already uploaded
the sample index.html and error.html
files
for cloudfront distribution creation go
to the cloudfront console
choose create a distribution
in origin domain option
select the bucket that you created
for s3 bucket access
select yes use oei
this way the bucket can restrict the
access to only cloud friend for origin
access identity select create new oai
then enter the oi name and choose create
for bucket policy select
yes update the bucket policy
if you want to associate custom domain
name with your cloudfront distribution
then you must select custom ssl
certificate
select a certificate from the drop-down
list that covers your custom domain
if you do not have certificate you can
choose request certificate
doing this takes you to aws certificate
manager to get a new
certificate provide your custom domain
in alternate domain name
if you don't want to use any custom
domain you can skip the steps to add
certificate and the domain name create
distribution and wait for it to be fully
deployed
update the dns records for your domain
to point your website's cname to your
cloudfront distribution's domain name
you can find your distribution's domain
name in the cloudfront console in the
format that is similar to d123 force
abcd.cloudfriend.net
i have already pointed my custom domains
cname dns record
to my cloudfront distributions domain
name you can now validate your
configuration by accessing your custom
domain name or cloudrin distribution
domain name
the second way is using a website
endpoint as the origin with anonymous or
public access allowed
note that when you use amazon s3 static
website endpoint
connections between cloudfront and
amazon s3 are available only over http
to use https connections between
cloudfriend and amazon s3 configure an
s3 rest api endpoint
for your origin
for this method first we must create an
s3 website endpoint for our bucket
i will use same bucket that i created
earlier
go to the s3 console
and then choose your bucket
select the properties tab
scroll down to the static website
hosting section
note that the s3 website endpoint is
different than the rest api endpoint of
s3
for more details choose learn more
this document also covers the key
differences between the two endpoints
choose enable and select host aesthetic
website option
provide the object names of your index
and error documents
save the changes
from the static website hosting dialog
box copy the end point of your bucket
without leading
http you will use this in later steps
add a bucket policy that allows public
read access to the bucket that you
created
note that for this configuration the s3
buckets block public access settings
must be disabled
if your use case requires the block
public access settings to be enabled
then use the rest api method described
in earlier section
for cloudrin distribution creation
go to cloud console
choose create distribution
for origin domain
paste the s3 website endpoint that you
copied earlier
be sure not to select s3 bucket name
from drop down list because you will be
using the rest endpoint
the reminder of the cloudframe
configuration can be used as described
in earlier section
update the dns records for your domain
to point your website's cname to
cloudfront distribution's domain name
you can find your distribution's domain
name in the cloudfront console in the
format that is similar to d1234
abcd.cloudfriend.net
i have already pointed my custom domains
cname dns record to the cloud run
distribution domain name
you can now validate your configuration
by accessing your custom domain or your
cloudfront distribution's domain name
the third way is using website endpoint
as the origin with access restricted by
a referrer header in second method we
allowed public read access to s3 packet
which implies that anyone can directly
access s3 bucket endpoints without
cloudfront
to allow only cloudfront to access the
content we can use this method
in this method we are going to use a
secret referrer header value that's
passed by cloudfront to s3
update the bucket policy so that it only
allows requests that contain the
specific referrer header value
go to s3 console and enable static
website hosting as explained in the
second method
copy the endpoint you will use this in
later steps
for cloudfront distribution creation
go to cloudfront console
choose create distribution
for the origin domain paste the s3
website endpoint that you copied earlier
under add custom header choose add
header
for header name enter referrer
for value
enter custom header value that you want
to forward to origin which is s3 bucket
to restrict access to the origin enter a
random or a secret value that only you
know
the reminder of the cloudfriend
configuration can be used as described
in earlier sections
choose create distribution
open your website's packet from s3
console
then add a bucket policy that allows s3
get object permission on the condition
that the request includes the custom
referrer header that you specified in
earlier step
for this configuration the s3 packets
block public access settings
must be disabled
amazon s3 considers a bucket policy that
grants anonymous access restricted by a
referrer to be public
to block access for any request that
doesn't include custom referrer header
you can use an explicit dinner statement
in the bucket policy
as mentioned earlier if your use case
requires the block public access
settings to be enabled then consider
using rest api endpoint as an origin for
cloudfront
update the dns record for your domain to
point your website's c name to your
cloudfront distribution's domain name
you can now validate your configuration
by accessing your custom domain of
cloudfront name or cloud distribution
domain name
you can use aws cloud formation as well
to deploy your website on cloudfront and
s3
find the link to deploy the solution by
using cloud formation
in the article thanks for watching and
happy cloud computing from all of us
here at aws
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
